metadata.title: CVE-2023-38430 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.9. ksmbd does notvalidate the SMB request protocol ID, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1019-oem - 6.1.0-1019.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-aws - 6.2.0-1015.15~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic - 6.2.0-36.37~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
